title: Californication
author: VD
content_html:
They’ve wrecked their home state with their left-liberalism. Naturally, they have no recourse but to go pollute other states with their political filth:

Mike Reilly spent his lifetime chasing the California dream. This year he’s going to look for it in Colorado. With a house purchase near Denver in the works, the 38-year-old engineering contractor plans to move his family 1,200 miles away from his home state’s lemon groves, sunshine and beaches. For him, years of rising taxes, dead-end schools, unchecked illegal immigration and clogged traffic have robbed the Golden State of its allure.

This demonstrates why Open Doors libertarianism is logically untenable. There is no freedom to be found in a population determined to make themselves serfs. I don’t at all disagree with EAS’s previous contention that libertarianism is politically dead as of 2009, except to point out that it hasn’t been noticeably viable in the USA at any time since the early 1920s.
content_text:
They’ve wrecked their home state with their left-liberalism.  Naturally, they have no recourse but to
go pollute other states
with their political filth:
Mike Reilly spent his lifetime chasing the California dream. This year he’s going to look for it in Colorado.  With a house purchase near Denver in the works, the 38-year-old engineering contractor plans to move his family 1,200 miles away from his home state’s lemon groves, sunshine and beaches. For him, years of rising taxes, dead-end schools, unchecked illegal immigration and clogged traffic have robbed the Golden State of its allure.
This demonstrates why Open Doors libertarianism is logically untenable.  There is no freedom to be found in a population determined to make themselves serfs.  I don’t at all disagree with EAS’s previous contention that libertarianism is politically dead as of 2009, except to point out that it hasn’t been noticeably viable in the USA at any time since the early 1920s.
